['The meticulous design showcases harmony between nature and human cultivation.', 'Examples include ginseng (人参), ashitaba (鎌accianthus), oregano (迷茅), and wakame (海苔).', 'Examples include Sumi-e (ink wash painting), Ukiyo-e (woodblock prints), Origami (paper folding), Ikebana (flower arranging), and Bunraku (puppet theater).', 'The ceremony embodies principles of harmony, respect, purity, tranquility, and self-awarenayered with aspects such as Zen Buddhism, calligraphy, flower arrangement (ikebana), architecture, music, and poetry.', 'The practice emphasizes precision, control, flowing movement, and expression through various styles such as Kaisho (block-like), Gyosho (semi-cursive), and Sousho (sparse).', 'Some notable examples include Haiku (3 lines with 5-7-5 syllable pattern) by Basho Matsuo, Tanka (three lines with 5-7-5-7-7 syllables), and Renga (linked poetry).', 'Notable dishes include sushi, sashimi, ramen, tempura, udon, soba, teriyaki, sukiyaki, and kaiseki-ryori (multi-course meal).', 'Some well-known examples include Karate (empty hand), Judo (gentle way), Aikido (way of harmonious spirit), Kendo (way of the sword), Iaido (drawing sword), and Jujutsu (soft style).', 'Notable examples include Buddhist temples, Shinto shrines, castles, palaces, townhouses (machiya), teahouse-style homes (chashitsu), and contemporary skyscrapers and public structures like the Tokyo Tower and Osaka Castle.', 'Examples include traditional tansu (multi-drawer chest), wasei-eigo (Japanese-made English terms) like "wardrobe" or "bookshelf," and modern furniture designs by renowned craftsmen like Kawara Tange or Shiro Amano.', 'Notable examples include Noh (masked dramas), Kabuki (stylized acting with elaborate costumes and makeup), Bunraku (puppet theater), Rakugo (comical monologues), Kyogen (comic plays accompanying Noh), and contemporary Japanese cinema, including works by directors like Akira Kurosawa and Yasujirō Ozu.', 'Examples include strolling gardens (kaiyu-shiki), tea gardens (roji), dry gardens (karesansui), bonsai landscapes (jungle gyms or miniature forests), stone lanterns (torii), water features, and carefully placed plants such as maples, pines, azaleas, cherry blossoms, and moss.', 'Notable examples include the ancient classics like "The Tale of Genji" by Murasaki Shikibu (Murasaki), haiku poems attributed to Matsuo Basho, medieval Buddhist texts such as "Kegon Engi Emaki" scrolls, modern works from authors like Natsume Sōseki, Ryūnosuke Akutagawa, and Yukio Mishima, and contemporary best-selling novels by Haruki Murakami or Kazuo Ishiguro.', 'Examples include shamisen (three-stringed lute), koto (13-string zither), shakuhachi (bamboo flute), taiko drums, hand-clap percussions (tsuzumi or tsukeshime), and modern instruments like the electric guitar, keyboard synthesizer, and electronic drum pads.', 'Haiku, created by Matsuo Basho in the 17th century, is perhaps the most renowned form of Japanese poetry worldwide, often featuring seasonal imagery or a sudden moment of insight.', "Calligraphers are highly skilled artists who emphasize the aesthetic quality of their work through varying pressure, rhythm, and flow while maintaining precision, balance, and harmony with each character's structure and meaning."]
